title: Wright Brothers National Memorial: Park Home
body: They Taught the World to Fly!  Wind, sand, and a dream of flight brought Wilbur and Orville Wright to Kitty Hawk, North Carolina where, after four years of scientific experimentation, they achieved the first successful airplane flights on December 17, 1903.With courage and perseverance, these self-taught engineers relied on teamwork and application of the scientific process. What they achieved changed our world forever.                Volunteer   Wright Brothers National Memorial needs you! Find out how to volunteer at this historic place.        Every Kid in a Park   Every 4th-grader can get a free pass to visit thousands of federal lands for free!
